What are you trying to achieve?

 It may be better for us to just programatically display the name of the discipline in the title, if you start manully putting it in the name of the sport it will start to get pulled into lots of places you may not want it to appear? ie. pulldowns.

Well I've now done it - and changed lots of the image names as well so
they all pull through properly. One reason is that on the Sports
landing page we need the images to appear with all the Aquatics ones
first, so doing it this way ensures the right alphabetization. 

 

I *think* the Sports team actually wants Diving to always appear as
Aquatics-Diving. So let's leave it for now. At some point in the future
it may be a good idea to programmatically just show 'Diving' in selected
places, but for now let's keep it Aquatic-Diving.

 

Liz Goulding

Can you clarify a few things please:
- Did you edit that feature box yourself?
- Are you saying this is a general problem, with any page like this?

We've put in a fix so that it shouldn't happen again, but let us know if you see a recurrence or any odd behaviour around typing line breaks or pasting in multiple paragraphs (we'll do some more testing here too, but it seemed like it was worth getting in a likely fix asap in this case).

What time did you publish those, and the homepage, can you remember?

Hi Alex,

Not sure if what you are describing as (Homepage won't publish) is actually to do with Video on the home page (as the home page does seem to be publishing, but with a broken video)

If it is, read on... (else ignore me!)

Videos on the home page now need to be added  as a two stage process

i) create a video page for your video via the video screen (in the cms) http://london2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/video/
ii) then assign the url of that page in the home page eg. news/video/the-best-of-us.php

The reason for this two step process, is that by creating a video page we have
a) a single resource (ie. a page) for every video in the system
b) can then create various size thumbnails for this video (important on the new site)
c) can send a single url (the video age) to stamen
d) are ready for when a video supplier comes on board (in that we can automate the process of video pages being created and therefore you being able to select them in the cms)

I agree the way you select videos on the home page is less than ideal, one idea we had for the redesigned site is to base it on tags ie. you tag a video a #homepage (on the video page) and the latest 8 videos with that tag are automatically pulled though.

But currently, to get the new video live,

1) create a new page for it via the interface http://london2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/video/
2) paste the path tot hat page (start with news/video) into the top box on the home page.

Hope that makes sense

Jamie

The webcams look good to me now; http://www.london2012.com/plans/olympic-park/webcams/index.php 

Is that looking ok to you?

Yes, fixed the problem, thanks!

Lars, I have assigned this back to you in the hope that fixing the workflow will not be too hard to do.

subject: Is it possible to add annotations to image widgets?
description: In the context of creating a video thumbnail, using an existing image interferes with the workflow, so we wanted to put a warning in the screen not to reuse existing images. Any way of doing that (or switching off "Change picture")?

comments.value: With the result that you get broken images displaying on the site home page and image hub.
Need a better description, have tested on live and seems to work?

I think the fix here is that any "Image section" code that displays images (like the home page) needs to look for "Image pages" and then from those pages find the related thumbnail.

It shouldn't be driven by image thumbnails but by Image pages (I think in the redesign we need to click though to the actual image page, so it will need to work like this for the redesign anyway) 

The danger on relying on images is that there may be cases where we want to delete an image page but leave the thumbnails (ie. if the thumbnail is used on news)

Those promos should list image pages not thumbnails.

In other words:

All image pages have a thumbnails
All images (thumbnail) do not necessarily have to have an Image page (it just so happens most do)

I think we should always pull image-pages. 

What if we restrict deleting anything in photos/resized and only allow deteting image pages which leads to a cleaner version of this?
Hey, what's the status of this?
new workflow should fix this.

subject: Deleting image asset does not expire Image pages
description: With the result that you get broken images displaying on the site home page and image hub.
